page.title: 09NEW ROMNEY LITTLE RAILWAY
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED MR FARROW THE STATION MASTER ABOUT THE ROMNEY HYTHE AND DYMCHURCH RAILWAY,WHICH OPENED IN 1927 AND IS PARTICULARLY FASCINATING FOR TOURISTS BECAUSE OF ITS ONE THIRD SIZE. WHEN WE ASKED WHAT COULD BE SEEN FROM THE RAILWAY WE WERE TOLD LYMPNE CASTLE,PORT LYMPNE ZOO PARK AND MANY CHURCHES.THE RAILWAY GOES PAST JEFFERSTON LANE WHERE EDITH NESBITT,THE AUTHOR OF THE RAILWAY CHILDREN LIVED.AT THE NEW ROMNEY STATION HERE,YOU CAN SEE THE WORKSHOPS AND SHEDS AND VISIT THE MODEL EXHIBITION. HE TOLD US 70% OF THE PASSENGERS ARE FROM COUNTRIES LIKE FRANCE,AUSTRALIA,HOLLAND,SPAIN,AMERICA AND JAPAN.OUR BUSIEST TIME IS FROM 27TH JULY TO 4TH AUGUST.
